verses.roman:
dāsya, sakhya, vātsalya, āra ye śṛṅgāra
dāsa, sakhā, guru, kāntā,--'āśraya' yāhāra

synonyms: dāsya—servitude; sakhya—friendship; vātsalya—paternal love; āra—and; ye—that; śṛṅgāra—conjugal love; dāsa—the servant; sakhā—friend; guru—superior; kāntā—lover; āśraya—the shelter; yāhāra—of which.
translation: "The servant, friend, superior and conjugal lover are the shelters of the transcendental mellows called dāsya, sakhya, vātsalya and śṛṅgāra.
